content: Parable of the Vineyard Owner
Jesus began to speak to them [the chief priests, scribes and elders who were questioning Him] in parables:     [threw stones and]     [and destroy the evidence],

And they were looking for a way to seize Him, but they were afraid of the crowd; for they knew that He spoke this parable in reference to [and as a charge against] them. And so they left Him and went away.
Jesus Answers the Pharisees, Sadducees and Scribes
Then they sent some of the Pharisees and Herodians to Jesus in order to trap Him into  a statement [that they could use against Him].

They came and said to Him, “Teacher, we know that You are truthful and have no personal bias toward anyone; for You are not influenced by outward appearances  social status, but in truth You teach the way of God. Is it lawful [according to Jewish law and tradition] to pay the poll-tax to [Tiberius] Caesar, or not?
Should we pay [the tax] or should we not pay?” But knowing their hypocrisy, He asked them,
So they brought one. Then He asked them,  They said to Him, “Caesar’s.”
Jesus said to them,  And they were greatly amazed at Him.
Some Sadducees who say that there is no resurrection came to Him, and  questioning Him, saying,
“Teacher, Moses wrote for us [a law] that IF A MAN’S BROTHER DIES and leaves a wife BUT LEAVES NO CHILD, HIS BROTHER IS TO MARRY THE WIDOW AND RAISE UP CHILDREN FOR HIS BROTHER.
There were seven brothers; the first [one] took a wife, and died leaving no children.
The second brother married her, and died leaving no children; and the third likewise;
and so all seven [married her and died, and] left no children. Last of all the woman died also.
In the resurrection, whose wife will she be? For all seven [brothers] were married to her.”
Jesus said to them,  [that teach the resurrection]  [who is able to raise the dead]?

Then one of the scribes [an expert in Mosaic Law] came up and listened to them arguing [with one another], and noticing that Jesus answered them well, asked Him, “Which commandment is first  most important of all?”
Jesus answered,    [unselfishly]
The scribe said to Him, “Admirably answered, Teacher; You truthfully stated that HE IS ONE, AND THERE IS NO OTHER BUT HIM;

AND TO LOVE HIM WITH ALL THE HEART AND WITH ALL THE UNDERSTANDING AND WITH ALL THE STRENGTH, AND TO [unselfishly] LOVE ONE’S NEIGHBOR AS ONESELF, is much more than all burnt offerings and sacrifices.”
When Jesus saw that he answered thoughtfully  intelligently, He said to him,  And after that, no one would dare to ask Him any more questions.

The Widow’s Mite
And He sat down opposite the [temple] treasury, and  watching how the people were putting money into the treasury. And many rich people were putting in large sums.
A poor widow came and put in two small copper coins, which amount to a mite.
